author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: The story of the mysteriously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan, set against the backdrop of the Roaring Twenties.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel that tells the story of Winston Smith and his attempt to rebel against the totalitarian state in which he lives.

author: Harper Lee
description: A story of racial injustice and the loss of innocence in the American South, told through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel following the emotional development of Elizabeth Bennet, who learns the error of making hasty judgments and comes to appreciate the difference between superficial and actual goodness.

author: J.D. Salinger
description: The story of 16-year-old Holden Caulfield's experiences in New York City after being expelled from his boarding school.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The tale of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who embarks on an unexpected journey with thirteen dwarves to reclaim their mountain home from a dragon.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel that tells the story of the animals on a farm who rebel against their human farmer and establish their own dictatorship.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic high-fantasy novel that follows the journey of Frodo Baggins to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel that tells the story of the inhabitants of a futuristic society where human happiness is assured through the systematic suppression of individuality and critical thought.

author: Ray Bradbury
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel that tells the story of a fireman whose job is to burn books, which are forbidden, and to burn down houses where books are found.

book_name: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The story of a young wizard who discovers his magical heritage on his eleventh birthday, when he receives a letter of acceptance to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

author: Dan Brown
description: A mystery thriller following symbologist Robert Langdon as he investigates a murder in Paris's Louvre Museum and discovers a battle between the Priory of Sion and Opus Dei.

author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel about a young Andalusian shepherd who yearns to travel in search of worldly treasure, only to find it back home.
